comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Pre 1900 - St Mary's tower and transept incomplete. Compare with - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2779697753/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Strange, at first glance, and from the building work at St Mary's, they look to be about the same time.

But the corner building at centre bottom (see note) has been replaced.  That would surely take at least a year.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: A similar view by Henry King from the Sydney Mail, 21 August 1897... news.google.com/newspapers?id=BPlPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JZUDA... ; whether King's pic had been taken recently isn't indicated...newspapers keep photo archives to illustrate articles etc...but given the restoration work on St James spire appears to have been underway in mid 1894, these pics would appear to have been taken before then...here's an 1894 Sydney Mail item on the spire rebuild - news.google.com/newspapers?id=0DNVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=4pQDA...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I wonder whether that building on the corner of King and Elizabeth Sts might have been Riley's Hotel...per this SMH item there was building work going on there during 1894-1895 (column 2, 4th para from top) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13928662 ; and again in ?1898-1899 ('Tenders', column 6) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14179873 ... Another building to keep tabs on is the Supreme Court...it had an addition made to the St James Rd side...which was evidently completed by January 1896 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71240198 ; I wonder whether the additions would have been visible from the Australia Hotel.
